revised_title: Parity Non-Conservation in Weak Decays: Theoretical Survey and Implications
tldr: This article discusses the theoretical framework of parity non-conservation in weak decay processes, focusing on the role of neutrinos and their interactions. The author explores different types of neutrino theories, the implications of these theories on weak decay interactions, and the experimental predictions for various processes. The findings have significant implications for understanding the fundamental properties of particles and their interactions.
